document.masterDocTitle: Robber flies of South Korea — II. South Korean species of the Subfamily Asilinae Latreille, 1802 (Diptera, Asilidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Robber flies of South Korea — II. South Korean species of the Subfamily Asilinae Latreille, 1802 (Diptera, Asilidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Epitriptus pastshenkoae
Lehr, 1976
—
Lehr ( 1976 : 482 )
.
Machimus pastshenkoae
Lehr, 1999
: 609
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Machimus cf. pastshenkoae
falls closely between
Tolmerus
Loew, 1849
(without the excised male sternite 8 ) and
Machimus
(with a slight extension). The gonostylus also separates the genus.
Machimus cf. pastshenkoae
is proposed for the male’s slight sternite 8 extension with long medial hair.
Lehr ( 1999 : 609 )
gives the new combination
Machimus pastshenkoae Lehr
, into which this species may fall. In addition, Mr. Milan Hradský has indicated (pers. comm., 2005 ) that
Machimus pastskenkoae
may possibly be a synonym of
Machimus arthriticus (Zeller, 1840 )
, known from Japan . To date, the existing material has not been examined.

Field notes.
Machimus cf. pastshenkoae
inhabits perimeter thickets of open fields and burial mound areas surrounded by pine saplings and a deciduous shrub layer, where it forages and mates among fallen pine needles (its brown color blending in with dead needles), low grasses and flowering
Lespedeza
. The asilid appears in mid May, and is absent after late June in South Korea . Both species of
Machimus
are widespread in South Korea and occupy sympatric and allopatric habitats.
